intro: Tylophora stenoloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing elongated seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
